intro: Homogyne alpina var. cantabrica, commonly known as the Cantabrian alpine homogyne, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Spain. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
